text:
as you know President Trump tweeted that
you and your fellow not you specifically

but Republican senators are totally
quitters if you don't repeal and replace

Obamacare
he's also tweeted that he wants the

Republican Senate to vote on nothing
else until it makes good on the

health-care promise is this a good idea
to vote again on this bill that has

already collapsed good morning Jake
well the bottom line is Obamacare

markets are collapsing across the nation
insurers are designed to pull out of the

market so from my standpoint we do need
to stabilize those markets and the issue

is not going away
you know I continue to have discussions

with governors and House members and
other senators in terms of what is the

path moving forward so this issue isn't
going away in terms of exactly you know

what the order of legislation I really
do think we pry out to turn our

attention to the debt ceiling and
funding the government and tax cuts

until we can really get all the parties
together and from my standpoint that

really is you know again the Governor's
House member Sanders in the White House

on the same page in terms of health care
the president has been very critical

about the fact that you and your Senate
colleagues just started a month long

break after wrapping up a governance
period that's been called historically

unproductive Obamacare untouched as you
noted taxes have not been cut the border

wall remains unbuilt what do you say to
voters many of them in your own party

who look at the record and think that
the Republican Party's failed to deliver

well my preference would have been to
stay in session to you know grapple with

those issues I was talking about at the
same time getting back in the state and

talk to constituents on Friday I've
traveled with the Agriculture Secretary

Perdue and has some really informative
discussions with the farmers and

agriculture interests in the state so
you know we're not on vacation we really

are working and again I continue
discussions on health care as well as

taxes with my colleagues even though
we're not in Washington DC let's talk

about these farmers because President
Trump is throwing his weight behind

legislation that would cut legal
immigration in half over the next decade

you have noted that dairy farmers in the
great state of Wisconsin rely on

immigrant workers as currently written
would you vote no on this immigration

bill
well what I'm hoping is you know the

bill that the senators Perdue and cotton
introduced possibly combined with my own

guest worker visa program managed by the
states combined with Lindsey Graham and

dick durbin are doing we'll start a
serious discussion in terms what we need

to do in terms of fixing our incredibly
broken legal immigration system but you

know Jake if you take a look at the
facts on average we've been admitting

about a million people with legal
residences in 2015 where we have the

best data $0.65 of those were based on
family relationships 21% were diversity

refugees asylees and now there's only
14% have anything do with work now there

are literally hundreds of millions of
people that want to come in to America

to seek the opportunity that only
America really offers we should be

selective we should target those
individuals that can come here on a

merit-based system and add to our
economy cotton and Perdue are still

maintaining the spousal and minor
children priority so again let's have an

honest conversation about this let's try
and get the demagoguery out of it and

recognize that our number-one goal
should be how do we grow our economy

because we've got to grow our economy so
we can reduce our debt deficits we have

the resources to build our military so
we can address all these serious threats

facing America a bipartisan group of
lawmakers is pushing legislation now to

try to protect special counsel Bob
Muller from potentially being fired by

President trumpets being offered by
Chris Coons and Tom Tillis your

Republican colleague from North Carolina
if this bill would come to a would you

vote yes or no that's hypothetical I
don't see that the Bob Mueller is going

to be fired but I also was pretty pretty
vocal saying that I would have preferred

these congressional committees the House
the Senate Intel committees you know

finish their work issue their report
before we can begin thinking about a

special counsel let's face it the
history is special counsel special

prosecutors sometimes they go off the
rails they start going on witch hunts

and we have enormous challenges faced in
this nation we really don't need that

kind of distraction all right Senator
Ron Johnson of Wisconsin appreciate it

sir hope you have a good district work
period have a great day
